metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1283 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the XML_GetBuffer function in Expat through2.1.0, as used in Google Chrome before 44.0.2403.89 and other products,allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based bufferoverflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted XML data, arelated issue to CVE-2015-2716.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-browser-l10n - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-chromedriver - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
No subscription required

expat - 2.1.0-7
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195').
expat package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7').
xmlrpc-c package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
cadaver package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
audacity package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
libxmltok package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
